intro: Wahlenbergia songeana, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Wahlenbergia songeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
